frame.name: Change_posture
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Protagonist</fen> changes the overall position and posture of the body.
<ex><fex name="Protagonist">Smithers</fex> <t>leaned</t> <fex name="Direction">forward</fex> <fex name="Purpose">to grab the folder on the far side</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the change in posture which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of a <fen>Protagonist</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s state throughout the time they are changing posture.</def-root>

FE.name: Location
FE.definition:
<def-root>The place or setting in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s change of posture takes place.
<ex>The supplicant <t>sat</t> down <fex name="Location">outside the office</fex> and waited for the mayor.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The final state of the <fen>Protagonist</fen> after the change of posture.</def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Path</fen> is used for expressions that indicate the trajectory of motion without referring to the <fen>Source</fen> or the <fen>Goal</fen> of motion.
<ex>She <t>leaned</t> <fex name="Path">through the service door</fex></ex> <ex>Tim Thomas <t>leaned</t> <fex name="Path">forwards</fex> </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used for any expressions that indicate the endpoint of the posture change. Often this is the place that provides support for the posture.
<ex> John <t>leaned</t> <fex name="Goal">against the wall</fex> and closed his eyes</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Source</fen> is used for expressions that indicate the starting point of the change of posture.
<ex>Charles <t>stood</t> <t>up</t> <fex name="Source">from his armchair</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Direction
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used for expressions that indicate a line from the deitic center towards a reference point (which may be implicit) that is neither the <fen>Goal</fen> of the posture change nor a landmark along the way of the moving part of the body. Often <fen>Direction</fen> is defined with reference to the canonical orientation of the Protagonist, or the orientation imposed by an implicit observer.
<ex>Smithers <t>leaned</t> <fex name="Direction">forward</fex> to grab the folder on the far side.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> for which a <fen>Protagonist</fen> assumes a posture.
<ex>Sunil <t>bent</t> down <fex name="Purpose">to pick up the newspaper</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Distance
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used for expressions that indicate the extent to which the body (part) moves during the change of posture.
<ex> <t>Bend</t> back <fex name="Distance">as far as you can</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Point_of_contact
FE.definition:
<def-root>The part of the body that provides support to the <fen>Protagonist</fen> in holding the posture.
<ex>Smithers <t>crouched</t> down <fex name="Point_of_contact">on his haunces</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An action of the <fen>Protagonist</fen> whereby they achieve the change of posture.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: bend.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause one's body to fold, usually at the waist or the knees

lexUnit.name: stoop.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be in a position in which one's body is bent forward and downward

lexUnit.name: stand.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: rise to an upright position on one's feet.

lexUnit.name: stand up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: assume a standing position, typically from lying or sitting

lexUnit.name: kneel.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fall or rest on a knee or the knees.

lexUnit.name: kneel down.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: fall or come to rest on one's knees

lexUnit.name: lie down.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: assume a horizontal position on a supporting surface

lexUnit.name: lie.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move into a horizontal position on a supporting surface

lexUnit.name: sit.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move into a position in which one's weight is supported by one's buttocks rather than one's feet and one's back is upright.

lexUnit.name: sit down.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: assume a position in which one's weight is supported by one's buttocks rather than one's feet or back

lexUnit.name: sit up.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move from a lying or slouching to a sitting position

lexUnit.name: squat.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move into a position low to the ground in which one's knees are bent and the heels close to or touching the buttocks or thighs.

lexUnit.name: squat down.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: crouch or sit with the knees bent and the heels close to or touching the buttocks or thighs

lexUnit.name: lean.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be in or move into a sloping position.

lexUnit.name: sprawl.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: sit, lie, or fall with one's limbs spread out in an ungainly way.

lexUnit.name: sprawl out.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: lie, or fall down with arms and legs spread out in an ungainly way

lexUnit.name: crouch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause one's body to adopt a position where the knees are bent and the upper body is brought forward and down.

lexUnit.name: crouch down.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: assume from a standing position a posture where the knees are bent and the upper body is brought forward and down

lexUnit.name: huddle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: curl one's body into a small space.

lexUnit.name: hunch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move into a position in which one's shoulders and the top of one's body are bent forward

lexUnit.name: slouch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stand, move, or sit in a lazy, drooping way.

lexUnit.name: kneel up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: get on one's knees from a sitting or lying position

lexUnit.name: hunch up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: assume a posture of sitting or standing with one's shoulders raised and the top of one's body bent forward

lexUnit.name: rise.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: get up from lying, sitting, or kneeling

lexUnit.name: drop.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: sink to or towards the ground.
